revision.text: ==Classical Nahuatl== ===Etymology=== From {{m|nci|xochitl|xochi(tl)|flower}}. ===Noun=== {{head|nci|noun}} # {{lb|nci|literally}} [[flower]]-[[bearer]] # {{non-gloss definition|The term applied to a cross-dressing figure depicted, and described as having androgynous qualities, in the [[w:Florentine Codex|Florentine Codex]].}} ===References=== * '''2007''' (Winter), in ''Ethnohistory'', volume 54, number 1: ''Sexual Encounters/Sexual Collisions: Alternative Sexualities in Colonial Mesoamerica'' (edited by Neil L. Whitehead)
